alert.note: Alert for Genesee; Niagara; Northern Erie; Southern Erie; Wyoming (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 3:09PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN WYOMING...CENTRAL ERIE...SOUTHEASTERN NIAGARA AND SOUTHWESTERN GENESEE COUNTIES THROUGH 400 PM EDT... At 309 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms over Williamsville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, pea size hail, and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Buffalo, Cheektowaga, West Seneca, Clarence, Lackawanna, Kenmore, Depew, Tonawanda, Amherst, Lancaster, Hamburg, East Aurora, Williamsville, Darien Lakes State Park, Grand Island, Evans, Elma, Eden, Marilla, and Pembroke. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 48A and 57A. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Genesee; Niagara; Northern Erie; Southern Erie; Wyoming
